title: Vodafone Group
subtitle: “We're proud to announce the expansion of Instant Network Schools with UNHCR to bring high quality digital education to more than 500,000 young refugees” - Joakim Reiter, @VodafoneFdn Trustee and Group External Affairs Director, at today’s #RefugeeForum.pic.twitter.com/1Yg7Mrdj7q

title: Meritxell Relano
subtitle: 52% of all refugees are children. A refugee crisis is a child's crisis. #RefugeeForum Inclusion and access to national social services is the best approach for refugee children. pic.twitter.com/HCehmlloT8

title: Counterpoints Arts
subtitle: Announcing the 2020 Refugee Week Conferences, in London and Bristol this February! Join us to explore how arts and culture can bring communities together and help change the conversation about #refugees. Book now: http://bit.ly/RWConference2020 … RTpic.twitter.com/Ewg8rvhQ9H

title: MARY... THE IRISH INSAFIAN
subtitle: PM @ImranKhanPTI will be visiting Geneva to co-convene the first ever Global Refugee Forum (GRF) commencing on 17 Dec 2019. PM Khan, President Erdogan, & leaders from Costa Rica, Ethiopia & Germanys exemplary role for the protection and well-being of refugees will be recognised pic.twitter.com/lQxVv5P7et

subtitle:

title: Gillian Triggs
subtitle:
Protecting refugees requires the world to work together.

To support fair and efficient national asylum systems we’ve launched the Asylum Capacity Support Group at the #RefugeeForum today. This will play a key role in strengthening protection for refugees

title: Get Britain Cycling

subtitle: In Sicily to deliver a keynote at an EU women refugees and violence conference; hope to catch this important exhibition on women trafficking and organised crime between Nigeria and Italy. #SexTrafficking #VAWpic.twitter.com/PqFV7SjrPK

title: Stephen Brown
subtitle: Great to see the train of solidarity with refugees on the platform in Geneva #RefugeesForumpic.twitter.com/mWEGUk9HYc

title: GermanForeignOffice
subtitle: "Only 20% of the states participate in taking care of over 70 Mio. refugees. The message of the #RefugeeForum must therefore be: more solidarity in dealing with refugees, more international cooperation, more multilateralism." Foreign Minister @HeikoMaas in Geneva.pic.twitter.com/loXiwSF01K

title: Sebastiano Nino Fezza

title: Ivo Freijsen
subtitle: #Iran has a truly impressive track record in terms of inclusion of refugees and others “on the move” in national education systems so indeed very relevant to have #Iran speak at this session to showcase best practice and call on donors for enhanced support. #RefugeeForumpic.twitter.com/4f8SUv7ULe

title: Shashank Joshi
subtitle: Amid all the arguments, @AmyKazmin succinctly spells out the core problem with India's citizenship bill: it is "the first time India has incorporated religious criteria into its naturalisation or refugee policies." https://www.ft.com/content/b9767a42-1cfb-11ea-97df-cc63de1d73f4 …"pic.twitter.com/CTcvJrn2Rv

title: Davide Vignati
subtitle: The 1st Global Refugee Forum co-hosted by #UNHCR and Switzerland comes at the end of a tumultuous decade in which the number of refugees has risen to over 25mio people worldwide. The #RefugeeForum is an opportunity to translate the principle of responsibility-sharing into actionpic.twitter.com/b7LFr3WOkW

title: IOM Indonesia
subtitle:

title: IGADGRF
subtitle: Mr. Moumin Ahmed Chieck, Minister for Interior for the Republic of Djibouti tables the country statement at the #RefugeeForum Commits to extend support for tertiary education to refugees. title: Latymer Upper School

title: Sebastiano Nino Fezza
subtitle:
Chios, Greece December 2019
A Syrian woman sits in a tent with her children in the Vial refugee camp on the island of Chios. The Vial camp has a capacity of 1,000 people, but nearly 5,000 refugees currently live there in inhumane conditions...
(ph: Louisa Gouliamaki) pic.twitter.com/zaFtGkTZg5
